actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 5371.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5371 and H. Res. 719. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 5371 and H. Res. 719 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on H.R. 5371.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 722. H.R. 5371 â€” "Making continuing appropriations and extensions for fiscal year 2026, and for other purposes."

The House received a communication from the Honorable Maxwell Frost. Mr. Frost submitted his resignation from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. The resignation was accepted without objection.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Reverend Elliott J. Powell, Westminster Presbyterian Church, Lubbock, Texas
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
